title: Base R Data Structures
text:
Create two vectors. One vector corresponding to the pre measurements and one to the post measurements. Assign names to the vector elements using the paste() function.

pre <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
post <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
names(pre) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post) <- names(pre)
pre; post

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 


 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 


Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements.

diff <- pre - post
diff

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients.

mean(diff)

[1] 5.65


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment (a positive change).

which(diff > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset the vector of differences to only return those that have a positive change.

diff[diff > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased.

mean(diff[diff > 0])

[1] 10.6

title: Base R Data Structures
text:
Create two vectors. One vector corresponding to the pre measurements and one to the post measurements. Assign names to the vector elements using the paste() function.

pre <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
post <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)
names(pre) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post) <- names(pre)
pre; post

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       120        151        125        126        115        132        132 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       129        134        139        127        122        127        135 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       133        128        147        138        140        132 


 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
       127        145        135        122        115        122        123 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
       126        126        129        132        146        120        114 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
       121        120        128        120        133        115 


Calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements.

diff <- pre - post
diff

 Subject_1  Subject_2  Subject_3  Subject_4  Subject_5  Subject_6  Subject_7 
        -7          6        -10          4          0         10          9 
 Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 Subject_11 Subject_12 Subject_13 Subject_14 
         3          8         10         -5        -24          7         21 
Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 Subject_20 
        12          8         19         18          7         17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure across all patients.

mean(diff)

[1] 5.65


Determine which patients experienced a decrease in blood pressure after treatment (a positive change).

which(diff > 0)

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         2          4          6          7          8          9         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
        13         14         15         16         17         18         19 
Subject_20 
        20 


Subset the vector of differences to only return those that have a positive change.

diff[diff > 0]

 Subject_2  Subject_4  Subject_6  Subject_7  Subject_8  Subject_9 Subject_10 
         6          4         10          9          3          8         10 
Subject_13 Subject_14 Subject_15 Subject_16 Subject_17 Subject_18 Subject_19 
         7         21         12          8         19         18          7 
Subject_20 
        17 


Calculate the average decrease in blood pressure for those where the blood pressure decreased.

mean(diff[diff > 0])

[1] 10.6

title: Base R Data Structures
text:
Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice
Create a data frame object with four columns corresponding to data above: patient, pre_bp, post_bp, and diff_bp.

bp_df <- data.frame(patient = names(pre), pre_bp = pre, post_bp = post, diff_bp = diff, row.names = NULL)
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
2   Subject_2    151     145       6
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
4   Subject_4    126     122       4
5   Subject_5    115     115       0
6   Subject_6    132     122      10
7   Subject_7    132     123       9
8   Subject_8    129     126       3
9   Subject_9    134     126       8
10 Subject_10    139     129      10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24
13 Subject_13    127     120       7
14 Subject_14    135     114      21
15 Subject_15    133     121      12
16 Subject_16    128     120       8
17 Subject_17    147     128      19
18 Subject_18    138     120      18
19 Subject_19    140     133       7
20 Subject_20    132     115      17


Return only rows of the data frame where the diff_bp column is negative.

subset(bp_df, diff_bp < 0)

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24


Add a new column to the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not.

bp_df$low_post <- bp_df$post_bp < 120
bp_df

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_post
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7    FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145       6    FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135     -10    FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122       4    FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0     TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122      10    FALSE
7   Subject_7    132     123       9    FALSE
8   Subject_8    129     126       3    FALSE
9   Subject_9    134     126       8    FALSE
10 Subject_10    139     129      10    FALSE
11 Subject_11    127     132      -5    FALSE
12 Subject_12    122     146     -24    FALSE
13 Subject_13    127     120       7    FALSE
14 Subject_14    135     114      21     TRUE
15 Subject_15    133     121      12    FALSE
16 Subject_16    128     120       8    FALSE
17 Subject_17    147     128      19    FALSE
18 Subject_18    138     120      18    FALSE
19 Subject_19    140     133       7    FALSE
20 Subject_20    132     115      17     TRUE


Print out the data frame nicely in final document

knitr::kable(bp_df)

title: Base R Data Structures
text:
Task 3: List practice
For placebo data, create two vectors. One vector corresponding to the pre measurements and one to the post measurements. Assign names to the vector elements using the paste() function.

plac_pre <- c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130)
plac_post <- c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
names(plac_pre) <- paste("Plac_Subject", 1:10, sep = "_")
names(plac_post) <- names(plac_pre)
plac_pre; plac_post

 Plac_Subject_1  Plac_Subject_2  Plac_Subject_3  Plac_Subject_4  Plac_Subject_5 
            138             135             147             117             152 
 Plac_Subject_6  Plac_Subject_7  Plac_Subject_8  Plac_Subject_9 Plac_Subject_10 
            134             114             121             131             130 


 Plac_Subject_1  Plac_Subject_2  Plac_Subject_3  Plac_Subject_4  Plac_Subject_5 
            105             136             123             130             134 
 Plac_Subject_6  Plac_Subject_7  Plac_Subject_8  Plac_Subject_9 Plac_Subject_10 
            143             135             139             120             124 


For placebo data, calculate the change in blood pressure for each patient by subtracting post-treatment measurements from pre-treatment measurements.

plac_diff <- plac_pre - plac_post
plac_diff

 Plac_Subject_1  Plac_Subject_2  Plac_Subject_3  Plac_Subject_4  Plac_Subject_5 
             33              -1              24             -13              18 
 Plac_Subject_6  Plac_Subject_7  Plac_Subject_8  Plac_Subject_9 Plac_Subject_10 
             -9             -21             -18              11               6 


For placebo data, create a data frame object with four columns corresponding to data above: patient, pre_bp, post_bp, and diff_bp.

plac_bp_df <- data.frame(patient = names(plac_pre), pre_bp = plac_pre, post_bp = plac_post, diff_bp = plac_diff, row.names = NULL)
plac_bp_df

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1   Plac_Subject_1    138     105      33
2   Plac_Subject_2    135     136      -1
3   Plac_Subject_3    147     123      24
4   Plac_Subject_4    117     130     -13
5   Plac_Subject_5    152     134      18
6   Plac_Subject_6    134     143      -9
7   Plac_Subject_7    114     135     -21
8   Plac_Subject_8    121     139     -18
9   Plac_Subject_9    131     120      11
10 Plac_Subject_10    130     124       6


For placebo data, add a new column to the data frame corresponding to TRUE if the post_bp is less than 120 and FALSE if it is not.

plac_bp_df$low_post <- plac_bp_df$post_bp < 120
plac_bp_df

           patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_post
1   Plac_Subject_1    138     105      33     TRUE
2   Plac_Subject_2    135     136      -1    FALSE
3   Plac_Subject_3    147     123      24    FALSE
4   Plac_Subject_4    117     130     -13    FALSE
5   Plac_Subject_5    152     134      18    FALSE
6   Plac_Subject_6    134     143      -9    FALSE
7   Plac_Subject_7    114     135     -21    FALSE
8   Plac_Subject_8    121     139     -18    FALSE
9   Plac_Subject_9    131     120      11    FALSE
10 Plac_Subject_10    130     124       6    FALSE


Print out the placebo data frame nicely in final document.

knitr::kable(plac_bp_df)




patient
pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp
low_post

Create and store a list with two elements: - 1st element named treatment that contains the first data frame - 2nd element named placebo that contains the second data frame

full_bp_list <- list(treatment = bp_df, placebo = plac_bp_df)

Access the first list element using three different types of syntax

full_bp_list[1]

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp low_post
1   Subject_1    120     127      -7    FALSE

Use full_bp_list list. In one line of code, access the pre_bp column of the placebo data frame.

full_bp_list$placebo$pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130
